headline: Danielle Smith, Mark Carney meet for 1st time after election

annotations.paragraph: Alberta Premier Danielle Smith and Prime Minister Mark Carney met for the first time on Friday since Carney won Monday’s federal election.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides essential information about the meeting between Smith and Carney following the election.

annotations.paragraph: Smith posted about the meeting on social media on Friday afternoon.
annotations.reason: This paragraph adds context about how the information was shared publicly.

annotations.paragraph: “Just finished a positive first meeting with Prime Minister Mark Carney,” she wrote.
annotations.reason: This paragraph includes a direct quote from Smith about the meeting.

annotations.paragraph: Smith said the prime minister promised to rapidly advance “nation building projects” to increase market access for Alberta’s oil and gas, agricultural products and other goods.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides specific details about the outcomes of the meeting.

annotations.paragraph: She said the trade war with the United States was also discussed.
annotations.reason: This paragraph adds relevant information about the topics discussed during the meeting.

annotations.paragraph: “Repairing the damage to Alberta’s economy caused by Ottawa’s last ten years of anti-resource legislation and policies will take tremendous effort and cooperation, however, today’s conversation was a positive first step,” Smith wrote.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides a direct quote from Danielle Smith about the meeting's significance.

annotations.paragraph: Carney has not posted about the meeting.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides relevant information about Mark Carney's public response to the meeting.

annotations.paragraph: The prime minister is also scheduled to meet with U.S. President Donald Trump at the White House on Tuesday.
annotations.reason: This paragraph is unrelated to the meeting between Danielle Smith and Mark Carney.
